help.title: Help & Support
help.subtitle: Complete guide to setting up government credentials for automated guest reporting
help.important_desc: To use HostShield's automated guest reporting to Slovak police, you need valid eID credentials from a Slovak certification authority. This is a legal requirement for electronic communication with government systems.
help.ico_desc: Your 8-digit Slovak company identification number (Identifikaƒçn√© ƒç√≠slo organiz√°cie). This is assigned when you register your business.
help.eid_desc: A qualified electronic certificate from a Slovak certification authority (Disig, eIDAS Bridge, etc.) for legal entities.
help.keystore_desc: A .keystore or .jks file containing your public certificate. Usually provided by your certification authority.
help.privatekey_desc: A .key or .pem file containing your private key for signing authentication tokens. Keep this secure!
help.step1_title: Obtain eID Certificate from Certification Authority
help.step1_desc: You need to obtain a qualified electronic certificate from an accredited Slovak certification authority. The most common providers are:
help.step1_1: Generate a certificate request on your computer
help.step1_2: Submit the request to the registration authority
help.step1_3: Schedule an appointment with the registration authority
help.step1_4: Visit in person with company documents (Business Register extract, ID)
help.step1_6: Receive your certificate files (keystore and private key)
help.step2_desc: After receiving your certificate, you should have two files:
help.security_desc: Never share your private key file with anyone. HostShield encrypts it using AES-256-GCM encryption before storing it.
help.step3_desc: Once you have your certificate files, upload them to HostShield:
help.step3_1: Go to Settings ‚Üí Government Credentials tab
help.step3_3: Enter API Subject (usually the same as your IƒåO)
help.step3_5: Upload your private key file (.key or .pem)
help.encryption_desc: Your credentials are immediately encrypted using AES-256-GCM encryption and stored securely. Only your server can decrypt them.
help.step4_desc: After uploading, you must verify your credentials to ensure they work correctly:
help.step4_2: HostShield will test authentication with the government API
help.step4_3: If successful, you'll see a "Verified" badge
help.step4_4: You can now submit guests to the police automatically
help.step4_note_desc: Verification may take a few seconds as it connects to the government API. If verification fails, check that your certificate is valid and not expired.
help.trouble1_a1: Check that your certificate is not expired
help.trouble1_a2: Ensure you uploaded the correct keystore and private key files
help.trouble1_a3: Verify your IƒåO is correct (8 digits)
help.trouble1_a4: Contact your certification authority if the issue persists
help.trouble2_a2: Private key must be .key or .pem format
help.trouble2_a3: Files must not be corrupted or password-protected
help.trouble3_q: Where do I find my IƒåO?
help.trouble3_a: Your IƒåO (Identifikaƒçn√© ƒç√≠slo organiz√°cie) is your 8-digit company ID. You can find it:
help.trouble3_a1: On your Business Register extract (V√Ωpis z Obchodn√©ho registra)
help.trouble3_a2: On official company documents and invoices
